Sentence.sentence: Fashion in America was logical and answerable to the will of the women who wore it.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: American designers prized resourcefulness and the freedom of women who wore the clothing.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Teenagers at risk of depression, anxiety and suicide often wear their troubles like a neon ( ' ,  霓虹灯 ) sign.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The outer layers of the volcano were worn away until the hard core stood completely exposed.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: The next morning, I just took all the pieces, assembled them together in my hotel room, and this is actually the skirt that I’m wearing right now.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: One day, I was invited to an important event, and I wanted to wear something special for it.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: I looked through my suitcase but couldn’t find anything to wear.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Technology has cut out much of life's donkey work, and we have more freedoms than ever: we can wear what we like and communicate with hundreds of friends at once at the click of a mouse.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Thus, wearing the right brand of clothes or shoes may be of the utmost importance.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: He wears a coat bought in the mall
Sentence.come: 出自-2014年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Even if I am on vacation in the mountains, I am eating food someone else has grown, living in a house someone else has built, wearing clothes someone else has sewn from cloth woven by others, using electricity someone else is distributing to my house.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: But look at it, it's awful, the paint has peeled off and carpet is worn and the stove is ancient.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: I looked through my suitcase but couldn't find anything to wear.
Sentence.come: 2016年12月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: Teenagers at risk of depression, anxiety and suicide often wear their troubles like a neon sign.
Sentence.come: 2016年12月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: The level of emissions they cause will depend on how the electricity to run them is generated, while brakes, tyres and toads all create tiny airborne particles as they wear out.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section A

Sentence.sentence: These designers established the modern dress code, letting playsuits and other active wear outfits suffice for casual clothing, allowing pants to enter the wardrobe, and prizing rationalism and versatility in dress, in contradiction to dressing for an occ
Sentence.come: 2017年6月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section C

means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 韦尔地貌名称，英格兰北部河流名，可能来源于凯尔特语，含义是“水”(water)

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词或词组均含"穿衣，穿"之意。
means: wear ： 最常用词，指穿衣、鞋袜或戴手套等，侧重穿戴的状态。
dress ： 普通用词，指给自己或他人穿衣。既表动作又可表状态。
put on ： 普通用语，指把衣服、鞋袜、帽子、手套等戴上去，侧重穿戴的动作。

Sentence.sentence: Adam and Galinsky tested the effect of simply wearing a white lab coat on people's powers of attention.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语浙江卷（11月） 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: Also, don't wear loose clothes, long scarves, big necklaces, or loose belts — they get caught in something or fall into liquid.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语全国卷2 听力 原文

Sentence.sentence: But Cathy woke me up early next morning, wearing her swimsuit ready to go! I told her she shouldn't swim after a whole night's coughing, but she refused to give up and insisted she go.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语天津卷 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: But robins are in danger of wearing themselves out by singing too much.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语四川卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: But some students didn't want to wear the uniform.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语浙江卷 语法填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: But their interest soon wears off and by January those same toys can be found put away in the basement.
Sentence.come: 2014年高考英语全国卷1 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: Children of keepers remember inspectors wearing white gloves to run their fingers over door frames and windowsills looking for dust.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语湖南卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: Everybody wears the same style of clothes.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语浙江卷 语法填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: First of all, you must wear shoes that cover your feet in the lab.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语全国卷2 听力 原文

Sentence.sentence: From now on I will only be editing articles for PsyBlog while wearing a white coat to help keep the typing error count low.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语浙江卷（11月） 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: I just heard the bank where Dora works was robbed by a gunman wearing a mask.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语重庆卷 单项填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: If I hadn't been wearing one, I would have been injured.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语天津卷 单项填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: In our modern world, when something wears out, we throw it away and buy a new one.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语安徽卷 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: Indeed, they made only half as many errors as those wearing their own clothes on the stroop test one way of measuring attention.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语浙江卷（11月） 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: Is the psychologist wearing little round glasses and smoking a cigar more insightful?
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语浙江卷（11月） 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: People doing different jobs should wear different clothes.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语浙江卷（11月） 阅读理解 阅读B 选项

Sentence.sentence: Pupils at about 90 percent of British secondary schools wear uniforms.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语浙江卷 语法填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: So if moving the body can have these effects, what about the clothes we wear?
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语浙江卷（11月） 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: We're all well aware of how dressing up in different ways can make us feel more attractive, sporty or professional, depending on the clothes we wear.
Sometimes he wore a duck hat, and I would tell myself, he was definitely an fan of dr.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语江苏卷 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: The cyclists should all have to be made to use the cycle lanes and wear helmets, fluorescent Jackets and lights at night and in the morning.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语湖南卷 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: The foundation began another campaign called national red scarf day, a day when people donate $20 and wear red scarves in support of Canada's hungry and homeless.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语北京卷 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: They should pay some sort of tax and be fined for not wearing them.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语湖南卷 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: They usually have dirty hands and wear dirty work clothes.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语天津卷 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: They wear out, and as a result, we get old and eventually die.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语广东卷 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: Translated into high school terms, this means that if everybody you hang around with is laughing at what John wore or what jane said, then you can bet that wearing or saying something similar will get you the same kind of negative attention.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语浙江卷（6月） 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: We may think we're a culture that gets rid of our worn technology at the first sight of something shiny and new.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语全国卷I 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: What they found was that people wearing white coats performed better than those who weren't.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语浙江卷（11月） 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: You probably can wear shorts tomorrow.
Sentence.come: 2014年高考英语全国卷1 听力 原文

Sentence.sentence: But don't bother trying to kill off old habits; once those ruts of procedure are worn into the hippocampus, they're there to stay.
Sentence.come: 出自-2009年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Theirs was a serious business, and even those reviewers who wore their learning lightly,like George Bernard Shaw and Ernest Newman,could be trusted to know what they were about.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The theory also seems to explain the sudden and unexpected popularity of people was wearing, promoting or developing whatever it is before anyone else paid attention.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: In the 2006 film version of The Devil Wears Prada ,Miranda Priestly, played by Meryl Streep, scolds her unattractive assistant for imagining that high fashion doesn’t affect her, Priestly explains how the deep blue color of the assistant’s sweater descended over the years from fashion shows to departments stores and to the bargain bin in which the poor girl doubtless found her garment.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The point of a style upgrade isn’t to become more vain or to spend more time passing over what to wear.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The point of a style upgrade isn't to become more vain or to spend more time fussing over what to wear.
Sentence.come: 2016年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Trade publications counselled department stores that, in order to increase sales, they should create a "third stepping stone" between infant wear and older kids' clothes.
Sentence.come: 2012年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

sentences.en: This suit has been in constant wear for two years.

sentences.cn: 看看这双鞋子磨损的样子。

sentences.en: These shoes I bought last week are already showing signs of wear.
sentences.cn: 我上周买的这双鞋已经快破了。

sentences.en: There's a lot of wear in these tyres.
sentences.cn: 这些轮胎经久耐用。

穿着, 戴着; 蓄, 留; 擦

sentences.cn: 他穿着一件新外套。

sentences.en: She used to wear her hair long.
sentences.cn: 她过去把头发留得很长。

sentences.en: He wore a smile.
sentences.cn: 他面带笑容。

sentences.en: His trousers had been worn into holes.
sentences.cn: 他的裤子已经穿破了。

sentences.en: Will your father wear this idea?
sentences.cn: 你父亲会接受这个主意吗?

sentences.en: The ship is wearing its colours.
sentences.cn: 那条船挂着船旗。

调转(船)向下风(tack 之对)
磨损, 变旧, 用坏, 穿旧

sentences.en: This cloth wears well.
sentences.cn: 这种布很耐穿。

sentences.en: The coat is worn threadbare.
sentences.cn: 这件外衣已经穿旧了。

sentences.en: The house wore a neglected look.
sentences.cn: 这房子给人一种没人照料的印象。

data.mean: 接受，容许（尤指不赞成的事物）
wear out | wear sth↔out 磨薄；穿破；磨损；用坏
wear off 逐渐消失；消逝；逐渐停止

sentence.en: We may think we're a culture that gets rid of our worn technology at the first sight of something shiny and new.

wear表穿衣状态，put on侧重穿衣动作

Hurry up! Put your coat on!

jx.jx_en_mean: overcome someone or something by persistence
jx.jx_cn_mean: （以不懈的努力）战胜（某人)，克服（某事）

jx.jx_en_mean: use or be used until no longer in good condition or working order

lj.lj_ly: the type was used again and again until it wore out.
lj.lj_ls: 铅字反复使用，直到用坏为止。

jx.jx_en_mean: (wear someone/thing out)exhaust or tire someone or something

lj.lj_ly: an hour of this wandering wore out Lampard's patience.
lj.lj_ls: 这样漫游一个钟头，兰帕德失去了耐性。

jx.jx_en_mean: To break down or exhaust by relentless pressure or resistance.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 磨损，用坏：以不断的压力或阻力使磨损或坏掉
逐渐消失：效果逐渐减少

jx.jx_en_mean: To make or become unusable through long or heavy use.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 用坏：由于长时间或重复使用使或成为无用

jx.jx_en_mean: To use up or consume gradually.
&I{Chiefly Southern U.S.} To punish by spanking
jx.jx_cn_mean: &I{【多用于美国南部】} 痛打惩罚

lj.lj_ly: I'm going to wear you out!

phrase.cizu_name: wear the pants 或 wear the trousers 【非正式用语】

jx.jx_en_mean: To exercise controlling authority in a household.
To be weakened or eroded gradually
To become less convincing, acceptable, or popular, as through repeated use
jx.jx_cn_mean: 变得陈腐：因重复利用变得越来越不可信、不能接受或不吸引人

entry.def: When you wear something such as clothes, shoes, or jewellery, you have them on your body or on part of your body.

example.ex: He was wearing a brown uniform...
example.tran: 他当时穿着褐色的制服。

entry.def: If you wear your hair or beard in a particular way, you have it cut or styled in that way.

example.ex: She wore her hair in a long braid...

entry.def: If you wear a particular expression, that expression is on your face and shows the emotions that you are feeling.

example.ex: When we drove through the gates, she wore a look of amazement...
example.tran: 我们驶过大门时，她流露出惊讶的神情。

example.ex: Millson's face wore a satisfied expression.
example.tran: 米尔森一脸的心满意足。

entry.def: You use wear to refer to clothes that are suitable for a certain time or place. For example, evening wear is clothes suitable for the evening.

example.ex: The shop stocks an extensive range of beach wear...
example.tran: 这家商店备有各式各样的沙滩服装。

entry.def: Wear is the amount or type of use that something has over a period of time.
entry.tran: 耐用性;使用率;使用形式

example.ex: You'll get more wear out of a hat if you choose one in a neutral colour...
example.tran: 如果你选个中性颜色的帽子，戴的时间会更多一些。

example.ex: Rugs in the bedrooms got much less wear.
example.tran: 卧室里的小毯子用得少多了。

entry.def: Wear is the damage or change that is caused by something being used a lot or for a long time.

example.ex: ...a large, well-upholstered armchair which showed signs of wear.
example.tran: 有磨损痕迹、配垫考究的大扶手椅

entry.def: If something wears, it becomes thinner or weaker because it is constantly being used over a long period of time.

example.ex: The stone steps, dating back to 1855, are beginning to wear...
example.tran: 那些可以追溯到1855年的石阶开始出现磨损。

example.ex: Your horse needs new shoes if the shoe has worn thin or smooth.
example.tran: 如果马掌磨薄或磨平，就需要换新马掌了。

entry.def: You can use wear to talk about how well something lasts over a period of time. For example, if something wears well, it still seems quite new or useful after a long time or a lot of use.

example.ex: Casual shoes need to wear well...
Ten years on, the original concept was wearing well.
example.tran: 10年过去了，原先的概念仍不过时。

entry.def: If one person in a couple, especially the woman, wears the pants, or in British English wears the trousers, they are the one who makes all the decisions.
entry.tran: (尤指女性)当家，掌权(英国英语中用wear the trousers)

example.ex: She may give the impression that she wears the trousers but it's Tim who makes the final decisions.
example.tran: 她让人觉得是她当家，但实际上是蒂姆说了算。

entry.def: If your patience or temper is wearing thin, you are becoming annoyed and are likely to get angry soon.

example.ex: Her husband was sympathetic at first but his patience soon wore thin.
example.tran: 一开始她丈夫还抱以同情，可不久就失去耐心了。

entry.def: If you say that something is wearing thin, you mean that people do not find it funny or interesting any more and are becoming annoyed with it, because they have seen or heard it so many times.
entry.tran: (因听说的次数太多而)失去趣味，令人厌烦

example.ex: Some of Wilson's eccentricities are beginning to wear thin.
example.tran: 人们逐渐对威尔逊的古怪行为失去了兴趣。

entry.def: If you say that someone is the worse for wear, you mean that they are tired, ill, or in a bad state because they have been very active, been through a difficult experience, or been drinking alcohol.

example.ex: He arrived on January 9, disheveled and much the worse for wear.
example.tran: 他是1月9号到的，蓬头垢面，疲惫不堪。

means.word_mean: 2. a covering designed to be worn on a person's body
3. the act of having on your person as a covering or adornment;
3. have in one's aspect; wear an expression of one's attitude or personality;

sentences.sentence: "The constant friction wore out the cloth"

means.word_mean: 5. have or show an appearance of;

sentences.sentence: "wear one's hair in a certain way"
"This dress wore well for almost ten years"
"The old chair finally fell apart completely"

means.word_mean: 8. exhaust or tire through overuse or great strain or stress;

sentences.sentence: "We wore ourselves out on this hike"
"He put on his best suit for the wedding"
"The princess donned a long blue dress"

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English werian, of Germanic origin, from an Indo-European root shared by Latin vestis 'clothing'

sentences.en: He likes smoothing down his shirt before wearing it.

sentences.cn: 穿着宽松衣物, 松开腰带 、 鞋等等.
sentences.en: To wear loose - fitting clothes, loosen your belt, shoes, etc.

sentences.cn: 她穿着色彩斑斓的衣物,戴着五颜六色的珠宝.
sentences.en: She wears a multicolored dress and jewels.

sentences.cn: 形容词,描述某人没衣物遮体的.
sentences.en: Nude: an adjective that describes when someone's not wearing any clothes.

sentences.cn: 穿毛皮衣物已经相当过时了。
sentences.en: Wearing fur has become deeply unfashionable.

sentences.cn: 朱迪穿旧衣裳以表示对习俗的蔑视.
sentences.en: Judy thumbed her nose at convention by wearing old clothes.

sentences.cn: 她吝啬得经常穿旧鞋而不愿买双新的.
sentences.en: She was too cheap to buy a new pair of shoes and wore the old ones.

sentences.cn: 我要把这件上衣穿旧,这样我就可以买一件新的.
sentences.en: I am wearing this coat up so that I can get a new one.

sentences.cn: 二十年前我们必须穿旧衣服.
sentences.en: Twenty years ago we had to wear shreds.

sentences.cn: 穿旧衣,买新书.
sentences.en: Wear the old coat and buy the new book.

sentences.cn: 就像一件穿旧了的、袖子上满是窟窿的套衫, 那是熟悉的东西,给人以慰藉.
sentences.en: Like a well worn jersey with holes in the sleeves, it � � s the comfort of the familiar.

sentences.cn: 我帮你把几条新牛仔裤洗一下,你暂且先穿旧的吧.
sentences.en: Wear your old jeans for the present , while I wash your new ones.

sentences.cn: 这件外衣已经穿旧了.
sentences.en: The coat is worn threadbare.

sentences.cn: 这套衣服有一些穿旧了的痕迹.
sentences.en: This suit is showing some signs of wear.

sentences.cn: 这个活儿有点脏，你需要穿旧衣服。
sentences.en: As the work tends to be a bit messy you'll need to wear old clothes.

sentences.cn: 有时,在接头处用一个小杠杆就能检测出耐用性.
sentences.en: Wear may sometimes be detected by using a small pry bar under the joint.

sentences.cn: 耐用性: 表面强磨损结构, 容易漏油, 连接部位容易松脱.
sentences.en: Durability: Strong wear surface structure, easy to spill, easy to loose joints.

sentences.cn: 微机检测汽车轮胎的耐用性和制动力.
sentences.en: Microprocessors monitor tyre wear and brake power on cars . v.

Sentence.sentence: Ask Nima Veiseh what he was doing for any day in the past 15 years, however, and he will give you the details of the weather, what he was wearing, or even what side of the train he was sitting on his journey to work.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: I mean, girls went around in really short skirts, and wore flowers in their hair.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: And men were in jeans, and could wear their hair long too.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Today’s consumers want beautiful handcrafted objects to wear and to have for their home environment.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Everything about the look and feel of a wallet—the way the fastenings and materials wear and tear and loosen with age, the plastic and paper and gold and silver, and handwritten phone numbers and printed cinema tickets—is the very opposite of what our world is becoming.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: She never bought clothes and always wore the same long, ragged black skirt.
Sentence.come: 出自-2014年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: If we ask Americans why they eat with knives and forks, or why their men wear pants instead of skirts, or why they may be married to only one person at a time, we are likely to get similar and very uninformative answers: "Because it's right.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Even if I am on vacation in the mountains, I am eating food someone else has grown, living in a house someone else has built, wearing clothes someone else has sewn from cloth woven by others, using electricity someone else is distributing to my house.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Finally, they all met an agree to wear ski-clothing to work the next day.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: I saw you wearing it last week, didn't I??
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: For instance, some people believe that wearing glasses too soon weakens the eyes
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: But there is no evidence to show that the structure of eyes is changed by wearing glasses at a young age.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Wearing the wrong glasses, however, can prove harmful
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: What do studies about wearing the wrong glasses show?
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Jill wore the overcoat last week.

Sentence.sentence: Do you remember anything about what he was wearing?

Sentence.sentence: I remember he was wearing a light shirt under the sweater

Sentence.sentence: A thirty-year-old guy wearing a light sweater.

Sentence.sentence: I have to wear white, and I have to keep everything in the kitchen totally clean.
